newsitem.title: UK: Man arrested over suspected Belfast bomb.
newsitem.headline: Man arrested over suspected Belfast bomb.

text.p: A man was arrested on Friday after security forces found a suspected bomb on the pavement of a Roman Catholic area of Belfast.
Troops and police sealed off the area and searched for further devices. The man was taken away for questioning.
The device was found in an area called Rosebank gardens in the Ardoyne area of Belfast, which is inhabited by members of the Roman Catholic minority.
Police said troops and police made the arrest and discovery after "suspicious activity" in the area.
Some reports said they had found a bag containing home-made mortar bombs, a favoured weapon of IRA guerrillas.
Belfast has been on high alert this year after a wave of attacks by Irish Republican Army guerrillas fighting to end British rule of Northern Ireland.
Last week IRA activists fired a rocket a Belfast's High Court in a daylight attack which raised fears of reprisals by their Protestant Loyalist foes.
Loyalists, who want Northern Ireland to stay British, have maintained a ceasefire since October 1994 but say their activists want to avenge IRA violence.
Police blame two recent attacks on Loyalists but the British government says it believes the ceasefire is still in place.
